intro: Acianthera scabripes, commonly known as the rough-leaved orchid, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and produces clusters of small, pale green to white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its root system is specialized for nutrient absorption, typical of many orchid species. Acianthera scabripes is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
